questions.question: @`wotf Windows Audit Event ID should be monitored for any changes to account information and account lockouts? (choose all that applies)
What information is/are gathered by the CSIRT when determining the scope of a security incident?
options: []The networks, systems, and applications affected by an incident
The amount of time and resources needed to handle an incident
The strategies and procedures used for incident containment
The processes used to preserve evidence
The users affected by an incident

questions.question: The IT administrator of a company wants to implement stronger security policy. @`wotf should NOT be in the security policies?
options: Provide secure communications between the overseas office and headquarters.
[]Implement certificate services on all offices.
Protecting employee data on portable computers.
[]Provide two-factor authentication.
Ensuring secure authentication.

questions.question: @`wotf approach(es) should security professionals take to mitigate a compromised system during the Actions on Objectives step as defined by the Cyber Kill Chain model?
options: Build detections for the behaviour of known malware.
Train web developers for securing code.
[]Detect data exfiltration, lateral movement, and unauthorized credential usage.
[]Perform forensic analysis of endpoints for rapid triage.
Collect malware files and metadata for future analysis.

questions.question: @`wotf approach(es) can an organization use to help block potential exploitations of a system?
options: Analyse the infrastructure path used for delivery.
[]Audit endpoints to forensically determine origin of exploit.
Collect email and web logs for forensic reconstruction.
Conduct full malware analysis.
[]Conduct employee awareness training and email testing.

questions.question: @`wotf is/are an event?
options: Obtaining confidential data and threatens to release these data publicly if the organization does not pay a designated sum of money.
A ransomware infection that encrypts all sensitive files in the company.
[]Access to sensitive data in share drives through an open connection.
A user performing unauthorized downloading of multiple software using the corporate network.
Exposing sensitive information online through illegal peer-to-peer file sharing services.

questions.question: @`wotf is/are part of a security analyst job functions?
options: Report incident to police.
Create security incident response policy.
[]Perform steps to remediate the incident.
Inform the CEO of a security breach.
Declare an incident.

questions.question: @`wotf activiti(es)would be conducted as part of the containment phase?
options: Compare recent backups with a current backup to remove malware that an attacker could use to regain access.
[]Segregate compromised systems to another network segment.
Verify the most recent system backup in case the system needs to be rebuilt later.
[]Change DNS entries to direct traffic away from the compromised system network.
Run tools used to gather information about an external attacker from an uncompromised system on the network.

questions.question: According to NIST standards, which incident response is/are responsible for coordinating an incident response with other stakeholders to minimize the damage of an incident?
options: Human Resources.
Legal department.
[]Management.
IT support.
Media department.

questions.question: How can a security information and event management system in an SOC be used to help personnel fight against security threats?
options: By filtering network traffic.
[]By collecting and filtering data.
By authenticating users to network resources.
By encrypting communications to remote sites.
[]By detecting and classifying threats .

questions.question: Which two(2) of the following Windows Audit Event ID should be monitored for failed logins and account lockout? (Choose all that applies)
@`wotf approach(es) should security professionals take to mitigate a compromised system during the Actions on Objectives step as defined by the Cyber Kill Chain model?
options: Build detections for the behaviour of known malware.
Train web developers for securing code.
[]Detect data exfiltration, lateral movement and unauthorized credential usage.
[]Perform forensic analysis of endpoints for rapid triage.
Collect malware files and metadata for future analysis.

questions.question: The process of finding and exploiting vulnerabilities using exploitable scripts or programs is known as...
options: Infiltration
Identification
[]Exploitation
Cracking

questions.question: @`wotf activities are part of an incident response Containment step following a malware detection on a single workstation?
options: []disconnect workstation from the network
leave the workstation in normal operation status for monitoring activities
remove the malware from the system
[]obtain an image of the infected workstation
gather information of the infected workstation

questions.question: One of the users in a company reported that his computer is under a ransomware attack. @`wotf is the first step to be taken by an incident handler?
options: Declare an incident
[]Validate the incident reported
Log the reported incident to the system
Perform a malware analysis on the reported user's computer

questions.question: @`wotf activities are part of the Detection and Analysis phase in the incident handling and response life cycle?
options: Retention of evidence collected from an incident
Development of an incident containment policy
[]Incident prioritization
Performing recovery on the affected computers
[]Incident identification based on signs of an incident (e.g., alert from IDS)

questions.question: You have been tasked to extend the network for an enterprise. The networking, to be done in the new extension, requires different types of cables, training new skillsets and an appropriate networking policy that will be decided by you. Which phase of the incident handling process lifecycle is involved in your decision for deriving the networking policy?
options: []Preparation
Post-Incident
Recovery
Detection & Analysis
Containment
Eradication

questions.question:
A security analyst wants to be alerted when there are activities related to:
 >RDP connections to the file server.
 > Encrypted file transfer activities in the network.
 @`wotf Event Stream Analysis rule type(s) would be the most effective to deploy? Select all that applies.
options: []Simple filter rule
Event window rule
Followed by rule
Application filter rule
Network truncate rule

questions.question: @`wotf is/are true about filtering rules?
options: Events are retained in the memory when no conditions are matched.
[]Do not take up memory since the events are not retained beyond the initial evaluation
Depends on the memory of data per event to generate an alert.
[]Are used to eliminate the IP addresses and destinations with the heaviest traffic
Evaluate a set of events over a time with events matches a condition

questions.question: @`wotf is/are false with regards to Event Windows Rule?
options: Each matching events is retained in the memory until the time window has passed.
The memory consumption is dependent on the amount of data per event
[]Evaluates a chain of incoming events to determine if the sequence of events matches a condition.
Evaluates a set of events over a time period with events matching a condition
Events are removed from the time window after a specific time when it fails to meet the threshold.

questions.question: Correlation Rule is used when...
options: you want to be notified when a single event occurs .
you want to create parsers and feeds.
[]you want to be notified when an event occurs within a time frame.
[]you want to be notified about multiple events occurring within a time frame.
[]you want to validate and detect for compliance violation.
you want to create a security policy

questions.question: @`wotf statements describe a TOR Network?
options: TOR networks are used to securely connect to a remote network over an unsecure link.
[]TOR networks provide anonymous browsing and routing.
TOR networks can easily be discovered by using Google search.
[]Attackers use TOR networks to conceal identities and online activity.
A TOR network can be accessed by any web browser.
